Row.Text: Tojo
History

Hideki Tojo was a general of the Imperial Japanese Army (IJA), the leader of the Imperial Rule Assistance Association, and the 40th Prime Minister of Japan during most of World War II, from October 17, 1941 to July 22, 1944. As Prime Minister, he was directly responsible for the attack on Pearl Harbor, which initiated war between Japan and the United States, although planning for it had begun before he entered office. After the end of the war, Tojo was arrested, sentenced to death for Japanese war crimes by the International Military Tribunal for the Far East, and was hanged on December 23, 1948.

Prime Minister of the Empire of Japan
Prime Minister of the Empire of Japan

Hideki Tojo, by the grace of His Imperial Majesty, Prime Minister to Japan and Her imperial possessions, you stand at the charge of the burgeoning war machine of the Japanese Empire. At the turn of the 20th century, the Empire of Japan had rapidly become an industrial and military behemoth, and she sought power and prestige like that beheld by the powers of the West. Under your directive, Japan would wage war upon her classical enemies in China and South-East Asia, seeking the hegemony of the Pacific coast. But this would culminate into a confrontation against the United States of America, which would lead to the Empire's most terrible loss, and your most terrible shame.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Dutiful Tojo, the forces of Japan once again stand in obediance to the Chrysanthemum Throne. Though Japan's foes are many, her powers are great, and her desire for glory and honour supreme. Can you take charge and lead her Imperial forces once more? Can you, in service to the honour of your Emperor, raise Japan to the heights of power far beyond that beheld in the West? Can you build a civilisation that will stand the test of time?

The Yamato is a unique unit for Tojo's Japan, replacing the Battleship. Slower than the Battleship, the Yamato receives a +100% Attack Bonus against cities and can carry up to two fighter air units.

The Yamato-class battleships were battleships of the Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) constructed and operated during World War II. Displacing 72,000 long tons (73,000 t) at full load, the vessels were the heaviest and most powerfully armed battleships ever constructed. The class carried the largest naval artillery ever fitted to a warship, nine 460-millimetre (18.1 in) naval guns, each capable of firing 1,360 kg (3,000 lb) shells over 42 km (26 mi). Two battleships of the class (Yamato and Musashi) were completed, while a third (Shinano) was converted to an aircraft carrier during construction.

Dojo

A dojo is a Japanese term which literally means "place of the way". Initially, dojos were adjunct to temples. The term can refer to a formal training place for any of the Japanese do arts but typically it is considered the formal gathering place for students of any Japanese martial arts style to conduct training, examinations and other related encounters.

The Dojo is the unique building for Nobunaga's Japan, replacing the Armory. The Dojo is available at Metal Casting and provides experience for military units built in this city. The Dojo provides additional experience for land units built in this city based on its [ICON_CULTURE] Culture output, especially if this city contains a Temple. Can only be built if this city contains a Barracks.
